author: Special Correspondent
text:
The CBI has arrested three railway officials in different parts of the country on charges of demanding bribe for recruitment.

One of the accused, Sunil Kumar, is posted in the national Capital. “We received a complaint that Sunil, a trackman with the office of the Divisional Railway Manager in Delhi, had demanded Rs.3 lakh from a person to facilitate his recruitment as a helper in the railway workshop,” said a CBI official. Based on the complaint, the CBI registered a case. The agency laid a trap and arrested the railway employee when he was allegedly receiving Rs. 50,000 from the complainant. During interrogation, the accused disclosed the name of another railway official, Sukhdev Singh Rawat. Subsequently, he was also arrested.

In another case, the CBI arrested a goods guard, Mahboob Basha, who is posted with the South Central Railway at Guntur in Andhra Pradesh. He has been accused of demanding Rs. 4 lakh from the complainant on the pretext of getting him recruited as an assistant loco pilot.

“According to the complainant, the goods guard claimed that he could help him get the job of an assistant loco pilot, for which he demanded Rs.4 lakh. The complainant’s father gave Rs.60,000 to the accused through cheque as first instalment,” said the official.

The accused demanded the remaining amount to process the job application. Based on the complaint, the CBI laid a trap and arrested Basha when he was allegedly receiving a cheque for Rs. 3.4 lakh from the applicant.
title: CBI arrests 3 railway officials on graft charge
